SpyOnMe
SMS Control Reply to Email Find Me Call Me Back Sound Alert Take Picture
ON OFF
This allows your phone to be controlled remotely through SMS. You setup a secret keyword (keep it safe!) that will cause your phone to interpret the next word(s) in your message as a command. Click on each feature to get its description and learn how to use it, options inside brackets are optional. Each feature may be enabled or disabled by clicking on the button next to it. Commands may start with either upper or lowercase letter. Enabling this option allows you to text your phone from an email account via an SMS Gateway, sending an email to the address 1234567890@carrierDomain.com, where the numbers to the left of @ are your 10-digit phone number and the domain is specific to your phone carrier. Your phone will then automatically reply to the sender email address. You will need to provide login credentials to a Gmail account, which will be used to send the response email on behalf of your phone. IMPORTANT: You also need to authorize external access to your Gmail account by enabling “less secure apps” in settings: https://www.google.com/settings/security/lesssecureapps before this feature will work. You can create a dummy gmail account if you don't feel comfortable authorizing external access to your personal account. This allows the phone to respond to the find command with it's current or last known location. When enabled, the phone will respond to command with GPS coordinates. Hint: Copy-paste GPS coords to google search bar to get map This allows the phone to respond to the call command through phone service. When enabled, the phone will call back the number which texted it, unless a different number is specified. Hints: To call a land line, text via email and add 10 digit phone number after command (no dashes!). Use this feature to listen to your phone's surroundings. This allows the phone to respond to the alert command by playing a sound. When enabled, the phone will sound alert for specified duration or default duration if option is ommitted. Hint: Use this command to find your phone inside your house, it works even if you left the phone in silent mode. This allows the phone to respond to the pic command. When enabled, the phone will respond to command with a picture. By default it uses front camera, to use back camera add back option. Back camera can take picture using flash when flash option is added after back option. IMPORTANT: if texting from another phone, you must include a two letter idenfitier for the carrier of that phone. Hint: Use the back flash options when you suspect you dropped your phone at your seat in the movie theater.
Syntax: 
<Keyword> command [option1 [option2]]
Syntax: <Keyword> find Syntax text from phone: 
<Keyword> call 
 Syntax text from email: 
<Keyword> call 11122233331
Syntax: <Keyword> alert [15] 
 Note: Maximum duration is 25 s Syntax text from phone: 
<Keyword> pic cc [back [flash]] 
 Syntax text from email: 
<Keyword> pic [back [flash]] 
 cc is a two-letter identifier for the texting phone. Supported carriers: 
 at for at&t, 	 bo for boost mobile, 
 cr for cricket, 	 sp for sprint, 
 tm for t-mobile, 	 us for us cellular,
 ve for verizon, 	 vi for virgin mobile Permissions: requires SMS services Permissions: requires Email services Permissions: requires GPS services Permissions: requires Phone services Permissions: requires no services Permissions: requires Camera services and Reply to Email option enabled
